choices.text:
Put together a healthy meal plan for me for seven days.  I can't have dairy, garlic, honey, almonds, pistachios, or cashews
Here is your customized meal plan for the next seven days that meets all of your requirements and preferences. Please note that this plan includes three main meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) as well as two snacks per day. It also provides a variety of nutrients to keep you healthy and satisfied throughout the week.

Day 1:
- Breakfast: Oatmeal with berries and almond milk substitute (e.g., soymilk or rice milk)
- Snack: Apple slices with peanut butter
- Lunch: Quinoa salad with roasted vegetables, chickpeas, and balsamic vinegar dressing
- Dinner: Baked fish fillet over steamed broccoli and brown rice

Day 2:
- Breakfast: Mixed berry smoothie made from frozen fruit, banana, almond milk substitute (e.g., soymilk or rice milk), and chia seeds
- Snack: Pumpkin seed trail mix with dried fruits
- Lunch: Veggie burger patty on a whole wheat bun with lettuce, tomato, and avocado slices
- Dinner: Roasted cauliflower steak over quinoa pilaf with rosemary and lemon zest

Day 3:
- Breakfast: Overnight oats made from rolled oats soaked in almond milk substitute (e.g., soymilk or rice milk) for at least four hours, topped with fresh fruit and chia seeds
- Snack: Apple slices dipped in nut-free sunflower seed butter
- Lunch: Vegetable soup with white beans, kale, carrots, celery, and zucchini
- Dinner: Baked tofu cubes over roasted vegetables (e.g., sweet potatoes, broccoli) and brown rice

Day 4:
- Breakfast: Vegan scrambled "eggs" made from chickpeas, mushrooms, onions, and spices served with a side of fruit salad
- Snack: Pistachio-free pumpkin seed trail mix (see Day 2's snack)
- Lunch: Vegan sandwich with hummus, avocado spread, lettuce, tomato, cucumber slices on whole wheat bread
- Dinner: Baked tofu and vegetable stir fry over brown rice or quinoa pilaf

Day 5:
- Breakfast: Mango smoothie made from frozen mango, banana, almond milk substitute (e.g., soymilk or rice milk), and chia seeds
- Snack: Roasted pumpkin seed trail mix (see Day 2's snack)
- Lunch: Vegan burrito with black beans, roasted vegetables, salsa, avocado on a whole wheat tortilla
- Dinner: Baked sweet potato fries over steamed kale and lentil salad

Day 6:
- Breakfast: Overnight oats made from rolled oats soaked in almond milk substitute (e.g., soymilk or rice milk) for at least four hours, topped with fresh fruit and chia seeds
- Snack: Apple slices dipped in nut-free sunflower seed butter
- Lunch: Vegetable stir fry over brown rice or quinoa pilaf (see Day 4's lunch)
- Dinner: Baked tofu cubes over roasted vegetables (e.g., sweet potatoes, broccoli) and brown rice

Day 7:
- Breakfast: Vegan scrambled "eggs" made from chickpeas, mushrooms, onions, and spices served with a side of fruit salad
- Snack: Pistachio-free pumpkin seed trail mix (see Day 2's snack)
- Lunch: Vegan sandwich with hummus, avocado spread, lettuce, tomato, cucumber slices on whole wheat bread
- Dinner: Baked tofu and vegetable stir fry over brown rice or quinoa pilaf (see Day 4's dinner)
